title: Nizam al-Mulk
summary: Abu Ali Hasan ibn Ali Tusi (April 10, 1018 – October 14, 1092), better known by his honorific title of Nizam al-Mulk (Persian: نظام‌الملک‎, lit. 'Order of the Realm'[3]) was a Persian[4][5] scholar, political philosopher and vizier of the Seljuk Empire. Rising from a lowly position,[6] he was the de facto ruler of the empire for 20 years after the assassination of sultan Alp Arslan in 1072,[7] serving as the archetypal "good vizier" of Islamic history.[6]
